parameters: Okay, good. Here's three more things to
note before you continue. First, note that
when you tilt stacks over, the spot where
it used to be becomes empty.
Secondly, the color and height of stacks
indicates how long of a path they create.
Yellow is two, green is three, and blue is
Lastly, stacks can't be toppled over if
there's an obstruction in the way, namely
other pieces and the game board edge. Try
to avoid blocking your path in later levels.

No matter, the player can probably see it.
get confused, you're not the stack of
Those are stacks, or towers if you would
like to call them that. You can tilt stacks
over to create paths of pieces to reach
other stacks or the black goal piece.
How do I tip stacks over?
Use the arrow keys on your keyboard to
point the arrow in the direction you wish
to tilt the stack that "you" are currently
on. In this case, you want to point up.
The arrow keys are also your means of
moving between pieces, if you weren't
currently isolated on that one stack.
Press Enter or Space to tilt the tower over.
...just tilt the stack over. If you tilt
it the wrong way, click the button with the
two arrows to reset the level. You can also
skip this level by using the other button.
You can also press 'R' to reset the level,
as you may end up needing to do that a lot.
